target_audience.primary_persona: .NET developers who need to test code that interacts with the file system
secondary_personas: Software architects designing file system abstractions
Library authors building file management utilities
Enterprise developers building document management systems
pain_points: Testing file system operations requires creating actual files on disk
File system tests are slow and can leave orphaned test files
Mocking System.IO is complex and error-prone
Testing edge cases like full disk, permission errors is difficult
Integration tests with file systems are non-deterministic
goals: Write fast, isolated unit tests for file system code
Avoid side effects from file system tests
Simulate complex file system scenarios easily
Maintain clean test environments without cleanup code
target_audience.usage_context: Development and testing environments for .NET applications that perform file operations

product_vision.one_liner: A comprehensive virtual file system implementation in modern C# for testing and simulation
product_vision.problem_statement: When writing applications in .NET, you often need to write or read files. Testing this code against the real file system is slow, error-prone, and creates side effects. VirtualFileSystem provides an in-memory alternative.
product_vision.value_proposition: Modern C# implementation with fluent API, event-driven architecture, undo/redo support, and comprehensive testing capabilities - all without touching the real file system
success_metrics: Test execution speed improvements for users
Code coverage of file system operations in user projects

existing_features: Move and rename files and directories
Advanced search by name, content, and regex
known_gaps: Custom metadata support on files and directories (planned)
Rename directory has known issue (TODO in code)
technical_debt: TODO: fix rename directory issue in DemoCli
Some extension methods may need additional test coverage

differentiators: Modern C# 12/13 features (records, init properties, switch expressions)
Built-in undo/redo system with change history
Fluent API for intuitive file system operations
competitive_context.market_position: A modern, feature-rich alternative to System.IO.Abstractions with additional capabilities like undo/redo, events, and search - targeting developers who want more than just a mockable interface

technical: String-based file content (no native stream support)
resources: Single primary maintainer (Philippe Matray / Atypical Consulting)
